Method Detail

firstWord

public static java.lang.String firstWord(java.lang.String exp)
The method firstWord is used to get the first word of a user input.
The word can be either a single string of characters, without any empty spaces, or a compound word, that is, a sentence between a starting '('-character and an ending ')'-character.

Parameters:
exp - the String representation of the expression whose first word is desired.
Returns:
returns the first word of exp

allButFirstWord

Parameters:
exp - the String representation of the expression whose tail is desired.
Returns:
returns the tail of exp

unwrapParenthesizedWord

public static java.lang.String unwrapParenthesizedWord(java.lang.String exp)
The method unwrapParenthesizedWord is used to strip a parenthesized String expression off the leading '('-character and the ending ')'-character.

Parameters:
exp - the parenthesized expression to be un-parenthesized
Returns:
returns the expression without the leading and ending parentheses.

withoutBeginningQuote

public static java.lang.String withoutBeginningQuote(java.lang.String word)
The method withoutBeginningQuote is used to strip a quoted word off its leading quote.

Parameters:
word - the word to be un-quoted
Returns:
returns the un-quoted form word

isParenthesizedWord

public static boolean isParenthesizedWord(java.lang.String exp)
The method isParenthesizedWord is used to check whether an expression is parenthesized or not.

Parameters:
exp - the expression to be examined
Returns:
returns true if exp is parenthesized, false otherwise

isAtomicWord

public static boolean isAtomicWord(java.lang.String exp)
The method isAtomicWord is used to check whether an expression is an atomic word or not.

Parameters:
exp - the expression to be examined
Returns:
returnes true if exp is an atomic word, false otherwise
